data.current_summary: Request an access token
data.current_description: This is the means by which clients obtain access tokens to use the service. You can see how to construct an Ably TokenRequest in the [Ably TokenRequest spec](https://www.ably.io/documentation/rest-api/token-request-spec) documentation, although we recommend you use an Ably SDK rather to create a TokenRequest, as the construction of a TokenRequest is complex. The resulting token response object contains the token properties as defined in Ably TokenRequest spec. Authentication is not required if using a Signed TokenRequest.
data.description_suggestion: Exchanges a TokenRequest for an access token (TokenDetails) to authenticate with the Ably service. Accepts either a TokenRequest object or a Signed TokenRequest. Returns a TokenDetails object containing the token string, expiration time, and capabilities. Authentication is not required when using a Signed TokenRequest; otherwise, basic authentication is required. Tokens are used for subsequent API requests.

data.current_description: The Ably system can be queried to obtain usage statistics for a given application, and results are provided aggregated across all channels in use in the application in the specified period. Stats may be used to track usage against account quotas.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves aggregated usage statistics for the application across all channels for a specified time period. Accepts parameters for time range (start, end, unit), granularity, and limit. Useful for monitoring usage against account quotas and tracking application performance. Requires authentication.

data.description_suggestion: Exchanges a TokenRequest for an access token (TokenDetails) to authenticate with the Ably service. Accepts either a TokenRequest object or a Signed TokenRequest. Tokens are used for subsequent API requests via Bearer authentication.
